# Amanda Dodd

   [City Council](https://www.bothellwa.gov/Directory.aspx?DID=25) 

Title: Councilmember, Position 6

 [Email](mailto:amanda.dodd@bothellwa.gov)  

Amanda Dodd’s family moved to Bothell’s Queensborough neighborhood in 1993 when she was five years old. She has called Bothell home since then. Dodd is a proud alumna of Northshore schools and Lake Washington Technical College. Today, Councilmember Dodd lives in the Shelton View neighborhood with her family.

Dodd joined the Planning Commission in March 2020, serving on the commission through October 2022 when the King County Council appointed her to a vacant City Council seat. Dodd served the appointed council term through November 2023's election, winning election to a full term she is currently serving. Her current term runs from January 1, 2024, through December 31, 2037.

In addition to being involved in local government, Dodd is a Community Emergency Response Team volunteer and participated in Bothell Police’s 2021 Community Academy. She also serves as the Board President for the Snohomish County Transportation Coalition (Snotrac). Professionally, Dodd is a technical account manager at a software company.

Councilmember Dodd represents the Bothell City Council on following boards and committees:

· North Urban Human Services Alliance Board

· Snohomish County Tomorrows

· Snohomish County Cities and Towns

· Northshore Parks and Service Recreation Area Board (alternate)

· City of Bothell Human Services Committee
